result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and/or school.  Court apporoved electronic monitoring subject to HOC screening.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or vocational training.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Pursuant to 973.015 Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdmeanor,society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  Expungement is not contigent upon payment of costs, fees and surcharges.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Elwood Grumbo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIX (6) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for THIRTY-FOUR (34) DAYS time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or school.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.  EXPUNGEMENT IS NOT CONTINGENT UPON PAYMENT OF COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES.

JusticePoint Pre-trial Services.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their request to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint Pre-trial Services Violation Report.  Filed, sdg.
TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR RELEASE.  UPON RELEASE BAILTO REVERT TO $300.00 CASH BAIL (PREVIOUSLY POSTED).

Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SHANE B. appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  sdg

State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense was just appointed to this case TODAY.  Defense requested that the Motion to REVOKE be taken under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Court took the Motion to REVOKE under ADVISEMENT at this time.  Defense advised that since the Warrant was issued the Defendant has gained employment and has gathered his transcripts to enroll in school.  Defense advised that Defendant was picked up as a passenger in a traffic stop.  Defense requested a moderate CASH BAIL to ensure Defendant's appearance.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant and Shane B.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status Conference.  Review hearing scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Joseph Richard Reback in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that he spoke with the Defendant's Mother who advised him that the Defendant would be at Court today.  Defense does not know of Defendant's whereabouts.  Defendant attended TWELVE of FOURTEEN (12/14) of the last scheduled contacts.  Defendant missed the last TWO (2) contacts.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant needs to complete 16 (SIXTEEN) hours of Community Service.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Allen Elwood Grumbo in court with attorney Joseph Richard Reback.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for final pre-trial.   

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge Ashley, Branch 33, per Chief Judge Directive. Court ordered jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. canceled. 

Court admonished the defendant for having a positive THC test and informed him of the penalties for any further positive tests.  
 
Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
